WRITING.TITLE: A true robot is an "independent contractor", not an "employee". You tell it when/where to start, but not how to do the job.
WRITING.TEXT: Roomba is a robot, a remote controlled quadcopter is not.
I can see that, you need some kind of tan to amplify, it can't work miracles.
Just not after labor day!

It's mostly a matter of opinion, but I cite the following: * No one's skin is as white as white fabric, so it contrasts and can make skin look darker, you do need a tiny bit of a tan for it to work. Don't expect dramatic improvement. * As a photographer, I notice that a camera's light meter will overexpose a person's skin when they are wearing darker colors , making them look whiter, and skin will be underexposed when wearing lighter colors, making them look darker. This only applies in portraits where the subject takes up much of the frame.
Spray tan and spanx? Maybe a black shirt with a white collar??

WRITING.TITLE: LPT: If you want to look tan, wear white. If you want to look skinnier, wear black.
WRITING.TEXT: Sorry, gray doesn't achieve both!
It was intentional... attempting to be clever but clearly failing!

WRITING.TITLE: Are you sure this is your computer?
WRITING.TEXT:
I get a call from a relative, asking if a few minutes to solve a "computer issue".
Her: "I start up the computer, but it goes right into safari with a gray screen and Pat's (her husband) name"
Me: "Are you saying someone else is logged into safari, like into a different google account?"
Her: "No, it's like everything is different. I don't know what's going on."
Me: ...
Me: (I know she and her husband have similar computers) "Are you sure this is your computer, and not Pat's?"
Her:... "Oh my gosh... it's Pat's! But it was where I always keep my computer!"
Me: "HAHAHAHAHAHAHA"
Her: "Do not post this on Facebook!"
Me: "OK, mom"
Can you post a spoiler photo? I'm not seeing it...
Or anything safety related, really...

This is actually a popular "perception game" where they show you this and you say the first thing that you see. Theists see "God is now here", athiests see "God is nowhere".

Nope... I have hardly any music on my device (I stream using iTunes Music Match), and I have optimize storage checked for my photos (iCloud Photo Library). I have had suspicions for a while that something was slowly eating up storage behind the scenes, maybe they fixed something along those lines. Like a memory leak but with files.

It's gone up now to 10 GB free after a full day of regular use. I thought it could be the caches as well, but the app-specific caches seem to be the same size as before. I guess we'll have to wait and see how it looks in a week!
My free space shot up from 2 GB to 8 GB! Very pleased. (I have a 6+ 64GB, I'm always on the latest public version)

I'm betting it's just a very large apertures, high ISO shot with a 1/8 s or faster shutter speed which lets in a lot of light without needing a lot of time.

Good tip, less decisions in the morning make everything smoother. Also - take a cool shower in the morning. Not freezing, just cold enough that it's not comfortable at first, but your body gets used to it in a short time. Getting in is not pleasant, but the rest of the morning you will feel awesome and awake.
